text: I took a chance and got the adult size of this costume for my 5 foot-tall 12 year-old.  It was a good call as it fits very well other than the legs getting bunched up at his ankles‚Ä¶  But that‚Äôs easily solved.  The rest of it, the arms, and the torso are a perfect fit.There is a little fan at the waist that is powered by 4 AA batteries.  The fan fills up the costume by blowing air into it, and there are elastic cuffs at the ankles, wrists, and neck.  One cool thing is that the fan has a USB (A) connector, so if you‚Äôre out of batteries or need something that will last a long time, you can connect it to a rechargeable battery pack because of the USB connection. text: I'm 5'3 200lbs and 42DDNegatives- the string to tie the center of the chest ISN"T what is pictured. It was too short and wide...also its more of a goldish color and I had to use tweezers to help me string it through the eyelets. The eyelets - some were smaller than others and some were pretty big, some of them weren't in line with the others. It took the entire string to use all the eyelets and once its tied its too pulled together so it takes away the "sexy" effect the picture shows...Also, with wearing a bra you will see the bra through that area no matter how tight it is because the eyelets stretch so far and show cleavage. My boobs actually are too big for the chest area and the lone "belt" under the chest actually sits ontop on my boobs instead of under where its supposed to be- with a bra its easier to adjust by pulling your bra and boobs up higher and then they set where they are supposed to be but im sure much arm movement and it'll go back to being on top of the. The arms where the holes are cut for the off the shoulder look were a little tight.Positives- The colors were very bright and pretty! the quality of the costume is better than I expected!over all I would recommend this costume but be warned you NEED A SIZE UP! It came fast in the mail but im debating on if I should risk sending it back to order a bigger size and it not getting here or just wearing it since its for a family party and I'll only be using it for one night....

text: After reading the reviews, I ordered a men's medium for my almost 12 year old daughter.  She is 5 ft 1 inches and about 80 to 85 pounds. (Skinny kid)  She loves Spider-man and wanted to be Spider-man (for about the 4th year in a row!) but didn't want a costume that had "muscles" on it since she was a girl.  This fit perfectly.  It did have some extra room in it, but not too much... if you have some "extra" in the belly area, it may not fit as well.  She really looked like Spider-Man from the movies!! Everyone absolutely LOVED her in the costume.  The face mask has holes in the mouth area, the eye area, and maybe the nose area (I can't remember), but they are tiny enough holes that you don't notice unless you are up close to her, but large enough that she was fine wearing it all day.  It also held up pretty well.  She wore it to an indoor Halloween Trick or Treat event, traditional outdoor Trick or Treating, and to school for the Halloween/ Harvest Fest Parade (she's in 6th grade).  The head mask is attached to the whole outfit, so when she wore it to school (she wore it all day), she had to keep the mask down until the parade-time.  When it's down, it falls in front of her head, rather than in the back (like a hoodie) like we expected.  But she didn't mind at all.  Also, it is all one-piece, so I have no idea how the whole restroom-thing went!  It must have been fine b/c I didn't ask and she didn't volunteer anything!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2016

text: This costume is really nice, easy to wear, perfect for Halloween! (and, frankly, for lounging around playing video games). It's comfortable - cheap material, of course, but still comfortable - and warm. Here are my main points:1. Sizing - definitely order 1-2 sizes larger than you usually wear. I wear L usually; I got XL in this and I'm so glad I did because the XL is snug on me and I had to stretch the fabric slightly to get it to zip up all the way. So order 1 size larger if you want it snug, 2 if you want wiggle room.2. Construction - it's polyester so don't dry it in a machine or this costume will wind up even smaller than it originally was! But for the price, the fabric is pretty good and the seams are all sewn together well. The 'fur' on the hood and ears is really soft and nice, the hood is big enough to drape down on the forehead a bit which is nice. I'm impressed with the zipper too, which is a nice fat one instead of those cheap 'invisible' ones that always snag on the fabric and quickly break.3. Wearability - 10/10, this is great! Easy, comfortable. Definitely warm so that's nice for trick-or-treating outside, but may be a bit too hot at a crowded party indoors. Of course in that case you can always unzip it and still wear the wings and hood. Do plan on wearing shorts or leggings because this is just a jacket, no bottoms included.Overall, I'm thrilled. :) My favorite costume for years!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016

text: I'm actually surprised how well the costume fit considering I'm on the shorter side on humanity. I can't speak for all heights here, but the comfort zone is broad--probably ranging from 4'10" up to over 6' tall.  From a width perspective, anything more than a size 44 jacket is likely going to be a bit tight.The only detractors I can think of is that it can be a little difficult to see out of for longer distances and it seals well with little air escaping. This means it gets really warm in there and any gas passed doesn't blend quickly into the atmosphere. I've been hearing for years about how horrible my methane discharge was, but until I wore this costume, I never gave it much thought or consideration.  One medium blow from the back-facing fog horn was all it took. I almost threw up. I'm not saying that family, friends, children, neighbors, and passers-by are/were necessarily correct in their assessment of lethality, but after a couple hours sealed into this costume, I'm at least ready willing to concede there may be some validity.HDF

text: received this today for my 2-yr-old grandson who is obsessed with construction sites (check out the book "goodnight, goodnight construction site").  that particular book got him interested, and now he's in the middle of a full blown construction vehicle obsession.  I am enjoying it beyond words.  He put on his little vest - real reflective tape! just like the real thing.  there are several pockets and loops in which to place the hammer and saw that come with the outfit!  The goggles are dear, but he's a two year old, not going to happen. The only problem I found is with the helmet.  It's well made, only it just doesn't fit.  The inner band allows for adjustment, but it isn't enough.  Maybe older children have no problem with it.Today, I took him to a construction site.  We were able to stand by the fence, me holding my favorite little guy, while he was wearing his construction hat..  He watched mesmerized for an hour, and that's saying something for a 2 yr old.  The worker operating the digger got out and said, "I like your hat".  Well , need I say more.  Then cutest grin you've ever seen on a guy with a safety helmet, and I'm referring to both of them.

They used several different fabrics to give it depth. I was impressed that they put a half-slip inside the crinoline to keep it from being scratchy. It mostly stood up to one day in the park and one day of traveling through airports (she refused to wear anything else to travel home). text: I was skeptical of the quality because of the price, but was pleasantly surprised when it arrived. It was a bit awkward to get into the first time, but after watching a video online, I figured out that it's best to put the legs on first, pull them up like putting on a pair of pants, then sit down and basically "bend in" to the rest of the suit. Since I can't always count on having someone around to close it up, I was happy that the zipper is pretty easy to zip from the inside. I was also skeptical that the one small fan would "blow up" the suit, but in a couple of minutes, I was transformed into a T-rex that was almost too large for my tiny living room! Even though the air flow is good, I did take the advice from some other T-rexes and purchased a second fan that I've not installed yet. Not only good as a backup, I think it will help keep me cooler while wearing it. It wasn't terribly hot inside, but I was in an air-conditioned house. The battery pack is fully detachable from the fan making folding/storing easy. It is pretty compact when folded and will fit in a suitcase easily.

text: This costume is very cute, but not without flaws.  I do like the fact that it's a V-neck when zipped, because that's more comfortable to me. I expected the sizing to be a little off, but it's much smaller than I'd figured on. I bought a Large, and it's skin tight when zipped (and it's not flattering when it's that tight, it makes 'rolls' and lumps where I don't have them). I think I'll have to return this for a 1X, so that I can zip it comfortably with a light t-shirt under it.  Also, it's polyester felt -- not stretchy, ridiculously hot, and not breathable at all.  It feels like if you tug at it, the fabric will stretch into thin strips and tear apart.  For the warmth, if you live in the Midwest and sit outside in below-40-degree weather half of the time at Halloween like we do, you won't even need a coat when wearing this -- but you *will* be drenched in sweat because it's polyester.

text: My daughter wanted to be a doctor for Halloween so I figured this coat would be perfect for her.  It was beautiful!  Very well made and everything fits neatly in it's own pocket.  I did not even attempt to put batteries in the stethoscope since the other reviewers said it made a horrible noise and really, my 3 1/2 year old doesn't care if it makes noise or not. My only complaints are that on Amazon.com it says the age is 3-4 years and when I received it the package said 3-6 years so as you can imagine it was VERY large on my 3 1/2 year old but that just means she will be able to use it as a dress up play coat for a longer time.  My other problem is the ear buds on the stethoscope didn't even fit in her ears a little...they just fell right out!  She wore it around her neck so it worked out but they should really work on fixing that.  Other than those 2 issues, I loved this doctor coat and so did my daughter.

text: I have previously been happy with Melissa and Doug products, but this was a big disappointment. The costume is well-constructed and seemingly durable. Sizing seems appropriate. The accessories, however, fall far short of expectations. The bullhorn makes a sound by pushing a button. That's difficult for a 3 year old. The picture as part of packaging shows a girl speaking into it so I expected amplification. Not true. The fire extinguisher can be filled with water. All I can figure out is that the bottle needs to be squeezed to expel a water stream. That's impossible for 3 year old hands. When squeezed, it leaks since the screw on head is not a seal. The hat has adjustments for fitting. It's difficult to explain the inadequacies of the plastic insert band for adjustments, but once again a disappointment.

text: 5'8'' 160lb Guy here. I ordered a M/L and the dress fit exactly how I thought it would. Neckline was not too low but exposed a lot of chest hair. The corset is fully adjustable like a shoelace, and was actually pretty roomy for a M/L, I might have been able to get a S/M but I didn't want to risk it. The fringe on the top is a little itchy on your neck, but it's not too bad. I would recommend thigh-highs, red pumps, and a petticoat (which is not included), but obviously I'm not gonna invest in those for one night. text: We bought both the V-raptor and T-rex costumes.  They are both hilarious and awesome looking.  The T-rex costume has separate gloves and zips in the front.  This means you can get into the costume yourself, turn the fan on, and then zip it up without assistance from someone else.  You can also actually take the gloves off and do things (ie. drink beer.)The V-raptor costume has blow up hands attached to it and zips in the back.  I have no idea why they put the zippers in different places, but with the blow up hands and back zipper you pretty much need assistance from another person to zip up.  You also cannot really do anything while wearing it with the blow up hands.  I was hoping to drink beer and hand out candy, but that probably won't work. LOL.

text: I was the last alien in a line of 7 at a bluegrass music festival. We decided to walk up the path to main stage in a single file line and I have never laughed so hard in my life!!! It was July and hot so at first the constant air flow around your body which exits around you neck, ankles and wrists was quite nice but 30 minutes into us dancing and parading around the thing is just circulating hot air and now hot air is blowing out around your neck and face. Now I am still laughing at the entire scene when I realize the legs of my costume (which is like a parachute material) is now sticking to my sweaty legs and forcing me to waddle!!! WADDLE! Now I'm dieing of laughter! We make as quick of a run as was physically possible to get back to camp to get these things off that now feel our own personal saunas! I highly recommend them! We had a blast and were stopped several times for photos! The only other downside is sometimes the battery packs and fan/air intake fall off but after a quick snap back together they kept working! #campmotherfuckinfuckyeah

text: I bought this costume for Halloween as it seemed to be the only Sally costume that looked true to the movie version rather than the short skirted, "sassy" or altered versions. I'm 5' 8" and 135" and a 38B and the large fit well. I think the medium size would have been a little too tight and I can adjust the back with the ties to make it more form fitting if I want to. The only thing I didn't like about the costume is that the back is just a thin, pink material. You would have thought that the manufacturer would have used the same pattern in the back as in the front. Even if I had to pay a bit more, it would have made the costume 5-stars. I also didn't care for the yarn wig, which I replaced with another wig. The stitch sleeves come with the costume and it is a nice overall costume for a few hours of Halloween fun.

text: I gave this 5 stars because my nephew LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  (And I loved the price!!!)  I originally purchased it because my sister said he likes pretending he has a walkie talkie and talking like a cop every so often after he gets home from Pre-K. My nephew is in the phase of loving everything little boys usually love..monster trucks, muscle car toys, Nintendo D.S., all of which he got for Christmas.  With that being said, we purposely had this as one of his last gifts to open knowing he would be overwhelmed (he's 4) and preoccupied by other gifts he received though out the day.  I can't even explain how EXCITED he was when he saw it.  He had to put it RIGHT ON and he wore it the rest of the evening, even wore it for the car ride home :)  Great gift and great memories.  I would highly recommend it for the little ones who still have a great imagination!

The hat is a little large and even with the plastic insert to adjust it, it kept coming off. I decided to secure it inside with some hot glue, but otherwise, I have no real complaints. text: First let me say that the only reason I knocked off a star is that this costume was a bit smaller than expected. It does fit my son and we're keeping it as he will be wearing it within the month and will probably still be able to get into it for at least the next few months (something my kids love to do with their Halloween costumes) when he wants it to play around. But it is almost a bit tight in the waist although my son is only a size 7 and very very slim (we purchased the 7/8). Not uncomfortably so, but if you're in doubt, I'd recommend getting the next size up from what you think your child should be wearing.With that said, yes, it's a bit flimsy as would be expected for a once-wear item, but it's adorable and my son absolutely loves it. The hat is super-cute as well. The green is very vibrant, just like the video game and just what we were looking for. I really couldn't beat the price, either. I saw this exact costume on other sites and via other sellers and this was the lowest price I found. text: Perfectly timed for Halloween! My nephew desperately wanted to be a race car driver. His insistence came from finding a motorcycle helmet in the garage, so we knew a helmet was a must. We were elated to be able to give this to him!He is an average sized 5 year old, and the suit fit him just perfectly. He is 43lbs and 41 inches tall. The gathered cuffs make it easily adjusted for many sizes and heights. The zippered suit is simple but easy to put on and take off.The helmet was a thick plastic, which is an upgrade from those other kits where the helmets feel so thin that you know it will break any moment.The addition of the foam steering wheel helps add to the costume. However, this is more for the role play then to carry if you trick or treat. It becomes a hinderance when carrying a bucket and going door to door. Fortunately, it is light so it will be easy for mom and dad to juggle.

text: My 3.5 year old daughter told me I needed to be Cinderella for Halloween this year, so I bought this dress and it was LEGIT. After reading the reviews I also bought a hoop skirt for underneath and I think that was a good call. It made the dress a lot more full and "princessy". The dress comes with the blue headband and black choker. I bought the wig, opera gloves, and hoop skirt separately. I bought the L size. I typically wear a size 10 clothes. I have a large bust (36DDD) so sometimes, finding dresses that fit appropriately all over is a challenge. But the L worked out well and I even felt like it may have been slightly large in some places. I am 5'6 and this dress was VERY long, even with the hoop underneath. I had to hold it up to walk (I was wearing flats). Halloween was a great success, however, and numerous little girls in our neighborhood stopped to take pictures with me while we were trick or treating. You will BRING the Cinderella in this costume. It is a good buy.

text: So let my start off by saying that this is one of the best quality costume dresses I‚Äôve ever seen! The quality is exceptional. It‚Äôs just lovely!! When I showed it to my husband he thought it was something I bought for myself! Also a great value with all the bells and whistles that all little girls love, the Tiara, gloves, earrings, etc. were all nicely packaged and looked to be intact. I wanted to get an array of costume dresses for my soon to be 4 year old for her birthday. She is very tall, like in the 90th percentile for height. I almost always have to size up for her for clothes and sadly I feel that every size chart is a guessing game due to different sellers, I have ordered the same size (6x140) in dresses/costumes/clothes as I did in this and they end up being too small....and this was at least two sizes too big, So this does in fact run VERY close to true size and if only I could trust size charts would I have picked her appropriate size, Or let‚Äôs say accurate size and then account for getting a size she can grow into. That being said, I have actually considered keeping this for two years so she will have one that fits her when she‚Äôs 6 or 7! It‚Äôs that beautiful! But who knows what she will like in 2-3 years so I‚Äôm going to return it for a smaller size, and get my younger daughter one as well! I have a two year old that loves playing dress up with her sister. Very pleased with this product and would recommend you go by this sellers sizing!

text: My son wanted to be a policeman for Halloween so this was perfect. He loves the handcuffs and walkie talkie. I am glad it doesn't come with a toy gun or weapon. It does come with an ID badge you can personalize with the child's name and photo, a whistle and a "ticket." I have had to wash it on gentle cycle and it held up well. It does come with a few small parts that are easy to lose, such as the badge on the hat, which kept falling off and was soon lost. But in general it's been a great buy.

text: This thing is awesome! If you're 7 feet you'll fit in this costume. Tons of height room available. No way to use your hands unless you stick them out the zipper. Was not a problem for me. It stayed inflated. Everyone we met loved it and it was hilarious trying to find big puddles to stomp around in and dance around like a fool. And yes, more than one kid threw the baby shark song my way. A total blast!! My girlfriend just rolled her eyes but it didn't matter since I couldn't see her because the window was all fogged up. text: We bought this for my daughters 4th birthday and couldn't have been happier with it! I work in a pre-k daycare setting and know how hard children are on dress up clothes. We have had the item for 3 months and it has been played with many times at home and shared in the daycare and it is showing no signs of wear and tear as of yet. Many hours of pretend play for the pre-k kids. There are so many things children learn through pretend play. This product is well worth the money. The children who have been playing with it are between the ages of 2 and 6 so it fits a wide range of sizes. I figured this brand was just like all the teeny costumes I've tried on in Halloween stores so I ended up getting the XL instead of L. text: Way too much fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!The Jurassic T-Rex Inflatable for Adults is frickin' funny!~The fabric and zipper are great quality and will last for an entire event or multiple uses though you do have to watch for sharp edges just like most all costumes. Ya might wanna stay away from a smoking area, just in case because it would deflate and you'd look like sad T-Rex and no one wants that.~It doesn't look cartoon-ish as in colors or design, it looks like the picture with the browns and blacks dark enough as well as the mouth. You still wouldn't be mistaken for a real T-Rex so no worries there.~The cuffs and ankles have strong elastic though some reviewers mentioned they used tape to keep the air in. I suppose if you wear it to work every day it could stretch out but otherwise, it isn't a problem.~The viewing area is clear plastic under the chin so it's fun to try to walk through doorways or down steps since the head will flop all over making T-Rex look more...irritated.~It takes a couple of minutes to inflate (well, on an adult sized adult is wouldn't be as long) so when friends call from 10 minutes away, you can be ready to greet them in fabulous style.~It didn't get too hot or fog the view area but it's still snowing on and off and kept me warm. Summers would be a great way to lose weight if you wore it...roller skating? which I'd do around a lake up here just in case I needed to cool off. Hopefully no one will call animal control about that.SIZING:It runs a little small I think, I'm 5'3" 115lbs and it was just right for viewing because you could only see my eyes and not my face, no need for tape on wrists and ankles holding the air just fine. I'd say it would probably fit someone comfortably 5'10" 170lbs-ish though some reviewers haven't had a fit issue that are much taller. It would fit a general range of adult & teens as there was a lot of room in the rest of the costume which is why I put "fit as expected".The only drawback is the fan is really noisy, enough to where it bothered my Granddaughter so I had to take it off and couldn't hear people clearly that were in the same room. From the reviews, it wasn't something I expected to be that loud which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.Maybe I need to use some WD40 on it and see if it quiets down, otherwise, these are fun and have so many places to wear them just so people know you are the good kind of crazy.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2017
title: Everyone needs to have this for 'special' occasions, which could also mean going into work on Casual Friday
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: I purchased the doctor costume for my daughter for Christmas. It comes in a little plastic bag, (similar to what you'd get for your clothes from a dry cleaner), which is nice to keep around so you don't lose any of the accessories.You do need batteries! The kind you use for a watch in the stethoscope.On that note, you may get very tired of hearing the smoker's cough sound effect that comes out of the stethoscope. It switches back and forth between that and a heart beat. There are little plastic discs on the part of the stethoscope that would traditionally go in your ears, those are a little on the rough side and could hurt if your child stuck them in their ears, I recommend only putting it around their neck. It still can potentially scratch them, it needs to be polished or have a better quality.The thermometer is just a play one, you click it and it turns to different temperatures.The plastic on the ear checking instrument is a little on the rough side too where it may go in someone's ear.The doctor's mask has some velcro on the parts that are elastic that go around your child's ears, I'm not sure if it's my daughter having a smaller head, but this doesn't seem like it would aid too much in adjusting the size, this thing always comes off.Overall I'd say most of the plastic where it may have been cut by a machine might have some roughness to their edges. But I would still recommend it for price, alternatively you could buy a separate play doctor's kit to go with the jacket, which to me is the main selling point.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2012

text: My son wanted this for halloween.  He is 5'5 and 165 pounds at 12 years old.  When we got the costume we tried it on and found it was somewhat difficult to put on...awkward to say the least and def a 2 person job.  The costume came with all the correct parts and seemed to be made well however, on Halloween it didn't last more than 15 minutes.  We managed to go trick or treating at 6 houses and the costume began to fog up.  We had to stop to clean the view vent from the water accumulating and while doing so the costume ripped at the seam.  There was no pressure put on the seam it just ripped and wouldn't re-inflate as a result.  Needless to say my poor kid had no backup costume and ended up trick or treating in a t-shirt and shorts.  Worst of all, he had sweated so much inside the costume his clothes he wore underneath were soaking wet.  While this is a cute concept, it didn't work for us and was frustrating to have spent so much money only to have it rip and fog up. (sorry the photo is side ways, I can't get it flipped).

I saw a review where someone purchased this outfit on sale for $35 so it was a bit hard coughing up $59 for it when I am currently ‚Äúbroke‚Äù after reading all the reviews I ordered this in a XS which cost $3 MORE than the small. In regular clothes I am NOT an extra small but the costume Gives a bit of wiggle room. I am 5/6 in height, 135 lbs, 34a in bra, 27 inches waist, 37hips. The black onesie  underneath was a bit loose, not terrible, but I wish it was skin tight. The outer part fits perfectly. In the photo I am wearing green thong underwear and it‚Äôs not visible, you CAN wear underwear with this costume it just have to be high on the hips. When I wear the costume I will obviously be wearing black undies. The costume is quality. I am not wear a bra but will consider wearing one when I officially wear the outfit. The panels/skirt is s but long but that‚Äôs something that can be altered to suit your size. By the way.. text: I read a lot of reviews trying to figure out the right size to order, so hopefully this will help others. I'm 5'9", 180 (+/-) lbs, athletic build, typically wear M slim-fit shirts, 33x30 pants. The S/M was the right size for me. Sleeves were just a little shorter than I would have liked (maybe another 1/2"-1") and the legs were a bit long (2"), but with boots, it wasn't really that obvious. The overall fit was good. It was just a little tight when fully zipped and getting on/off - once you step in, getting the arms took a little twisting. The front has a double zipper so when zipped up with the top zipper, you can also zip up from the bottom when nature calls.The costume itself is great - good quality, many zipper pockets (2 chest pockets, 1 upper right thigh, 2 lower leg) and front/arm patches. As noted, there are both Maverick and Goose velcro patches. As others have noted, the bottom of the legs have zippers so I don't think there is a (easy) way to hem the legs if needed. There are also velcro bands on each wrist and both sides of the waist, to tighten as needed.Add a pair of sunglasses and dog tags (bought on Amazon) and you're all set!I also bought the M/L since I wasn't sure which size would fit. I didn't even bother trying it on, the legs would have been comically long.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2018
title: Great costume - sizing info
product name: Leg Avenue Men's Top Gun Flight Suit Costume

text: I'm not big on halloween but I'm a nanny and trick-or-treating is in the job description. Searched amazon for plus sized costumes hoping to find something a bit more conservative and got this! I was able to just wear black clothes under this costume/jacket/bat-hoodie and it was perfect! The hood stays put, the ears are filled so they stay up, the outfit was warm and comfortable and fit perfectly! This product is exactly as advertised and a perfect lazy costume. I'm psyched that I already know what I'll be wearing next halloween!!(It was a little warm this year and despite short sleeves under I did get a little hot under the fleece, but any other year I think warm would be a good thing.)

text: I have to say that everyone loved this costume.  It was a huge hit for my sons Halloween  activities.  Saying that, it embodied the trick or treat mantra because while it was a treat for everyone watching my son, (especially when he ran, jiggling the dino-bootie and when he fell on his back and couldn't get up) he felt a little on the tricked side.  Keep in mind, he is 9 yo, but the window did fog up on him, and he had trouble seeing after dark.  We finally had him stick his head out the top of zipper and was fine.The costume stood up to a few hours of walking on sidewalks and road, as well as quite a few deflates and reflates.  I did have to do a minor repair at the top of the zipper, but to my surprise I was able to sew it, and it held up fine.Overall, it is a great costume, but remember to wear light clothes, because it is warm and it is probably better suited for a party than trick or treating,  and is built well.  If you are on the line, go for it and get it, you will not regret it.

text: My 29 month old daughter LOVES this more than I could have imagined.  We customized the name badge provided in the pocket before wrapping it up for Christmas.  She plays with it daily.  I think the coat and mask are critical pieces that many other doctor play sets don't include. The stethoscope could be more real-life, but I think we'll just buy a real one when she's a bit older so she can really listen to our heartbeats.  For now the toy one included in this pack is fun - it requires 2 AAA or AA batteries and makes a heartbeat sound and coughing sound.  For older children - buy a real stethoscope to add on.  I highly recommend this set.  Melissa & Doug products are constantly impressing me.

text: My son LOVES this costume. He is average height and weight for a 3 year old. The jacket could fit a 5 year old, but I like that he has room to grow into it while still fitting him enough to play in it now. The accessories are durable and realistic and the jacket is excellent, heavy-duty quality. The reflector stripes actually do reflect, too, which is a fun component. The hat, which can take a real beating and still come out without a crack, sometimes falls off, but there is an adjustable part inside that helps once you get the right fit. My only issues is the velcro holders for the megaphone and fire extinguisher. The holder is two straps that velcro together, but it is very challenging for my son to maneuver the velcro and position the toys simultaneously to hang them there on his own. Overall, though, my son is VERY happy with his firefighter costume. It is absolutely worth spending a little more on this specific firefighter costume for the quality.

text: This is my favorite thing in the whole wide world. I‚Äôve already recouped 60% of the cost by winning $30 in a costume contest at work. I also wore it to see my friends‚Äô new baby and terrify their 18-month-old, as well as to a wedding rehearsal and dinner that were costume parties on Halloween weeekend. The perfect gift for any attention monger like myself. My two complaints that do not warrant a star being taken off are: 1) the wrist and ankle cuffs tend to ride up. It would be nice if they had a stirrup seen in to help keep them in place. I might find s way to do this myself. The mitts help keep the wrists in place a little better but there‚Äôs not much hope for the ankles. 2) I dropped the battery pack (my bad) and it split in half and one of the battery springs broke off and rolled away into the abyss off multicolored office carpet, never to be seen again. But I McGyvered it with the spring from a click pen and carried on to win my costume contest. Now off to panhandle on the streets by charging passersby to pose for pictures with me. text: This is the best costume ever, a one piece lycra jumpsuit. It is so realistic and well made. I am a woman 5'8", 32 inch waist, men's size 7 shoe, very athletic build. I went with s medium not a large like the package recommended and it fit great, very stretchy and could fit someone a bit larger. The only thing big on me was the feet which could probably fit up to a 9 shoe and the crotch since it is made for men. The hooded mask was just right with not much room left. It is skin tight so if you don't people to see your imperfections you might not like it. The only thing you might need to do is reinforce the feet. You could stand around indoors ok but if you are walking outside or jumping around they will rip. I bought a small tube of shoe goo and spread a good layer on them which was perfect. Also threw some insoles from my sneakers in them which was so comfortable and you couldn't  see them at all. Won best costume. I have been a collector of spiderman costumes and this is hands down the best one by a mile! I spent more on lunch than this costume!

text: Totally disappointed in this costume. I'm, first of all a guy who uses his wife's Amazon account, thus the name. I'm 5'7", 180. I wear a 34" in pants. I bought a large, which is supposed to fit 37"-39" waist. This is an awful costume. I was encouraged by the one photo that was posted of somebody in action in this costume. Made it look like a steal.The top was a bit oversized and the leather part -- which is most of the front of the top -- is cheap, cheap plastic. Stiff, doesn't move great. It looked and felt awful to wear. The pants, which were supposed to fit a guy who is 39" are too small for a guy who's a 34". The belt did not even fit all the way around me and, because it's Velcro, would not stay on even when forced.The 2-star rating is only elevated by the fact that it comes with a lot of chintzy accessories. The hood was pretty cool. I didn't even bother with the gloves but they looked huge, so that was a NOPE. There's a lot to this costume for the price they're asking. It would be a better costume if they cut half of the crap out and actually concentrated on making it a worthwhile purchase. Instead, it's an unusable costume because I'd say the top is an XL and the bottoms and belt are a S/M. This is going back. I spent $10 *more* but got a better costume at Spirit Halloween, which I was able to try on in-store.

text: It's a hilarious costume so I won't rate it lower.Hilarious costume fun to play in. This costume could fit different sized people from 4.5 to 6.5 feet tall. It packs up small.Things to be aware of:Included fan is just garbage - mine broke right away and I had to take apart to resolder the wires. It rattles and barely inflates the suit, plus is loud. I ended up finding a high flow 75+ CFM 120mm computer case fan and making a replacement fan housing out of a plastic tube. This was powered with 9V batteries and inflated the suit better and more quietly than the included fan.The suit is hot. Even my more powerful fan only helped a little. After several minutes you will want cool air.Rips can be repaired easily with duct tape on the inside, or Leukotape is almost the same orange and is extremely flexible and sticky.The sound unit is ridiculously overpriced. It plays one sound as far as I can tell and is not loud enough.

text: ¬†This inflatable dinosaur costume is awesome!  I  absolutely love it!  Our whole family has had fun, chasing each other around in it, dancing, surprising delivery people, and lots of other silly stuff. The fed ex delivery guy had a good laugh and said it made his day when a T-Rex opened the door. He said he‚Äôs seen a lot of strange stuff while making deliveries, but it was the first time he‚Äôs ever delivered a package to a dinosaur. It‚Äôs hard not to have fun wearing this costume. It fit everyone from my daughter who is 5‚Äô2‚Äù tall to my husband who is 6‚Äô tall. There were only a few features that I wasn‚Äôt crazy about, but they were definitely out numbered by the positive features and sheer fun of the costume. The arms are short and they are at an awkward height, but that‚Äôs just T-Rex anatomy.  The ‚Äúmittens‚Äù fit well and when tucked into the elastic on the end of the sleeves, they stayed on well. I found the costume surprisingly comfortable and easy to move around in once I got used to the arms. The fan is kind of loud but it inflates the costume quickly and keeps it inflated well.  Having someone hold the head up while it is inflating until there is enough air for it to stand on its own helps . There is good airflow inside the costume once it is inflated. It can however get a little warm inside  after a while if you are really active, especially running around outside in the summer. I really like the fact that there is a clip on the fan so you can clip it to the waist of your pants. It‚Äôs a little awkward if you aren‚Äôt wearing actually wearing pants (due to the heat in the summer) or if pants have an elastic waist. On those occasions, wearing a standard belt  (regardless of the pants situation) worked. The costume has held up well . The material is lightweight, but feels durable like parachute material. The clear window is easy to see out of although the range of peripheral vision is very limited.  I am very satisfied with this purchase and would buy another  if for some reason we ever have a need for more than one T-Rex.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2018
title: So much fun!!
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: I would normally wear a small, but I bought this in a large for a slightly loose, relaxed, oversized hoodie fit. I'm glad I ordered two sizes up, the sleeves are just the right length and there's just barely a little extra room underneath. It is also incredibly warm, so if that's something you're looking for in a costume, you won't be disappointed. I bought it as something to wear to the Disneyland halloween party. I wanted something to keep me warm outdoors late at night, something that wouldn't get in the way on rides or in crowds, or be at risk for getting messed up or losing pieces. Just something comfy, casual, cute, and also fits all the costume rules for the park. It is the perfect costume for what I was looking for and I'm very happy with it. There were just a couple things that kept me from giving it a 5-star review. First, that when I took it out of the package it had a very strong chemical odor that has taken a few days to air out, even after being washed. Second, the fur around the hood has a very rough edge, which I'm just picky about because I've worked with faux fur on craft projects before, and the craftsmanship seemed poorer than I expected for the price. However, it's still a cute costume that's perfect for what I need, and I expect I'll get a lot of enjoyment out of it!

text: I bought this in a size 4 for my granddaughter's recent fourth birthday and it fits nicely. She's kind of tall and thin so take that into consideration when ordering. The dress has no buttons or zippers to aid in getting it on and off, although there is a little stretch in the waist. It just gets pulled over the child's head or up over her hips. This is what's most important to consider in the dress fitting, unless you are a seamstress and want to modify it.The material is very pretty and soft against the skin thanks to lining. There's lots of fullness in the skirt and netting to support it. It was long enough to touch the floor and a bit too long for much activity. She stepped on it a time or two running around and nearly falling, so full of her birthday excitement.The sleeves are a lightweight, sheer/opaque fabric that also encircles the neck behind the collar and modestly covering the chest area.ReliBeauty shipped quickly, packaged their product well, and delivered within my expectations. I would order from them again.

text: This costume was better than I expected considering the price.  The main piece is well constructed and nice quality.  I'm 5' 6" 155 lb. with a slim build so I purchased a size Medium and it was a little large for me.  I'm just going to pin it in the back to make it work since I'm worried the Small may be too small for me.  This would have been a 5-star costume if the accessories weren't so cheap.  My first attempt to try on the right glove resulted in rip between the thumb and index finger, and I have small slender hands.  I put on the left glove on more gingerly but the glove didn't fit right at all.  As gloves, they were pretty useless so I cut the hand part of the gloves off and I'm just using the cuff parts on my forearms.  The belt for around my 32" waist was surprisingly too small considering how large the costume fit so I'm not using the waist belt at all.  There's a second belt that goes over the upper chest that I really couldn't figure out how to put on but it seemed that it would cover the best features of the main piece.  I was able to modify this belt by cutting the shoulder strap and using the longer part of the belt around my waist, which I felt looked better than that cheap belt that was supplied for the waist in the first place.  The leg pieces were well constructed but very tight on my slender legs.  I just had to make a slight modification on the bottom to make them work with the only pair of brown shoes that I owned.  Overall I'm happy with the costume and can't wait to wear it for this year's costume party.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
title: Nice Costume for the Price
product name: Renaissance Robin Hood Deluxe Men Costume Set Made of Leather for Halloween Dress Up Party

text: Product operated as it should. Because it is so thin, I assume for the inflation purpose, I felt we had to be extra careful when entering it or walking around. It can definitely puncture if you aren't careful enough. Also had to be careful with the zippers because it felt like it could easily tear if someone was too forceful. Inflation wasn't instantaneous but didn't take long. If wearing for Halloween trick or treating, here is what we experienced. 1. If getting in and out of a vehicle when trick or treating it will likely have to deflate and inflate each time going in and out of the vehicle because the head is tall and tail long. 2. Getting inside of the costume be sure to have your child duck under the zipper to pull it over. If they try to stretch it over their head it may bust the zipper out. 3. It was a little of a challenge for my child to see where their feet were going. Had to be the guide for some moments. 4. The battery pack for the fan clips on the child's waist of their clothing. Be sure they can handle that being clipped on there. 5. Because walking in a balloon is awkward, my child was getting tired of the walking  way before the other children. Once it got dark, the whole visual issue got worse as well. Overall, we still enjoyed the humor of the costume and people enjoyed seeing it. Just keep the points above in mind and consider the tendencies and tolerances of your child before buying.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2019
title: Satisfied but use discretion
product name: Rubie's Adult Official Jurassic World Inflatable Dinosaur Costume

text: I needed a Halloween costume for my son who just turned 6.  I chose Melissa and Doug because I know they are usually high quality and Amazon could get it to me fast.  I wasn't wrong!  High quality material, ours came on a little plastic hanger with a plastic covering so it can be stored again.  Front close is velcro so it was easy to get on and off.  The tools were made well and had fitted loops to hold them in (the saw kept falling out while trick or treating, though, so I carried that one after a while).  Another cute addition is the name tag- you can take it out and write your child's name on it, along with adding a photo if you want, so it looks like a real ID card!  Contrary to what others say in their reviews, our hat did come with an adjustable plastic ring inside of it, so you can change the fit of the hardhat.  We took it out all together since the hat fit my son well without it.  At the age of 6, this vest fit him just perfectly.  My son is tall and slender for his age.  He might be able to wear it again next year but my guess is it might be too short.  This was a comfortable costume for Halloween and my son wore it most of the day with no issues. Paired with kids work boots, it looked adorable!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2014
title: Great for a Halloween Costume!
product name: Melissa & Doug Construction Worker Role-Play Costume Set
